Tom Bewermeier ; editor, Bettina Böhler.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="511" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Jirka Zett, Miriam Horwitz, Angela Schanelec, Fritz Schediwy, Mark Waschke, Agnes Schanelec, Katharina Linder.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">After a long absence, the actor Irene visits her lakeside house where her brother Alex and her son Konstantin live. It is a hot summer. Konstantin's girlfriend Agnes is also there, spending the summer break at her family's house next door. Konstantin and Agnes grew up together although Agnes attends a university while Konstantin hasn't left his home by the lake. But when they see each other again, things are no longer the same, and every doubt is mercilessly exposed. Into this confusion enters Irene. Mother and son's common past repeats itself as a futile struggle for recognition, fought with irony and aggression.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="538" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">DVD; all regions; PAL; widescreen (16:9) presentation; Dolby Digital 2.0.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="546" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">In German with optional subtitles in German, all_text_timv: Nachmittag  / Nachmittagfilm Angela Schanelec, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg ; ein Film von Angela Schanelec ; Ausfürender Produzent, Gian-Piero Ringel ; Buch, Regie, Produktion, Angela Schanelec. Known in English as: Afternoon Germany naf Stuttgart ; Berlin : Filmgalerie 451, [2008] ©2008 1 videodisc (95 min.) : soun, color ; 4 3/4 in. two-dimensional moving image tdi rdacontent video v rdamedia videodisc vd rdacarrier digital optical stereo Dolby Digital 2.0 rda PAL rda video file DVD video region free rda Motion picture. Based on the play Chayka by Anton Chekhov. Originally released as a motion picture in 2007. Extras: "Das Kino der Angela Schanelec" von Geremia Carrara (74 min.); "Presseschau zum Kinostart"; 451-Trailer. Director of photography, Reinhold Vorschneider ; costumes, Anette Guther ; art direction, Ingo von Heland, Tom Bewermeier ; editor, Bettina Böhler. Jirka Zett, Miriam Horwitz, Angela Schanelec, Fritz Schediwy, Mark Waschke, Agnes Schanelec, Katharina Linder. After a long absence, the actor Irene visits her lakeside house where her brother Alex and her son Konstantin live. It is a hot summer. Konstantin's girlfriend Agnes is also there, spending the summer break at her family's house next door. Konstantin and Agnes grew up together although Agnes attends a university while Konstantin hasn't left his home by the lake. But when they see each other again, things are no longer the same, and every doubt is mercilessly exposed. Into this confusion enters Irene. Mother and son's common past repeats itself as a futile struggle for recognition, fought with irony and aggression. DVD; all regions; PAL; widescreen (16:9) presentation; Dolby Digital 2.0. In German with optional subtitles in German, English, French, Spanish, Italian, and Portuguese. notes_summary_ssim: After a long absence, the actor Irene visits her lakeside house where her brother Alex and her son Konstantin live. It is a hot summer. Konstantin's girlfriend Agnes is also there, spending the summer break at her family's house next door. Konstantin and Agnes grew up together although Agnes attends a university while Konstantin hasn't left his home by the lake. But when they see each other again, things are no longer the same, and every doubt is mercilessly exposed. Into this confusion enters Irene. Mother and son's common past repeats itself as a futile struggle for recognition, fought with irony and aggression.
